common_issues.title: PiecesOS Connection Issues and High Resource Usage
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS disconnecting, restarting, and causing high RAM/CPU usage. Suggested solutions include deleting specific folders, reinstalling, and using the 'Optimize Memory' feature. The Pieces team is actively investigating and patching these issues.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## Summary of GitHub Issue #676: High RAM Usage by PiecesOS

**Key Points Raised:**

* Several users reported high RAM usage by PiecesOS, including:
    * Memory usage exceeding 5GB for some users, even when not actively using the software.
    * High CPU usage observed in some cases.

**Problems Identified:**

* Memory leaks were suspected as the cause of the high RAM usage.
* The high CPU usage was attributed to the on-device ML processing capabilities of PiecesOS.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* A "Optimize Memory" option was added to the PiecesOS interface to unload unused ML models and free up RAM.
* The developers acknowledged the issue and committed to improving the performance of PiecesOS.
* A call to action was issued for users experiencing higher than expected RAM usage to contact the developers for further investigation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is still open as of November 2023.
* Some users have reported improvements after using the "Optimize Memory" feature.
* Others continue to experience high RAM and CPU usage, forcing them to discontinue using PiecesOS.

**Additional Notes:**

* The developers are actively working on improving the performance of PiecesOS and addressing the memory leak issue.
* Users experiencing high RAM or CPU usage are encouraged to contact the developers for further assistance.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Update Causes Plugin Issues and False Positives
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS updates causing plugin malfunctions in VS Code and PHPStorm, displaying errors like port occupancy. Proposed solutions include updating virus definitions, reporting false positives, reinstalling Pieces OS, and awaiting plugin updates.

related_issues.title: OSX/Nukesped.ext reported by VirusBarrier
related_issues.text:
OSX/Nukesped.ext reported by VirusBarrier
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Intego VirusBarrier has quarantined the following Apps as being infected with OSX/Nukesped.ext

- MacOSx/Applications/Pieces OS.app/Contents/Frameworks/App.framework/Versions/A/App
- MacOSx/Applications/Pieces.app/Contents/Frameworks/App.framework/Versions/A/App
- /Library/Caches/com.pieces.os/org.sparkle-project.Sparkle/Installation/rXFHYYDjc/Pieces OS.app/Contents/Frameworks/App.framework/Versions/A

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/32bfc7dc-fda4-4377-8eb1-348cab1106b6)



## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Problem:**

* User @idiston reported an issue where Intego VirusBarrier identified Pieces OS as infected with OSX/NukeSped.ext, a Remote Access Trojan (RAT) malware.
* The issue persisted even after a complete uninstall and reinstall of the latest version of Pieces OS.

**Analysis:**

* @tsavo-at-pieces provided detailed analysis of the situation, concluding it to be a likely false positive by Intego VirusBarrier. 
* Evidence included:
    * Detection pattern matching legitimate application framework paths.
    * Detections occurring in standard macOS application bundle locations.
    * Files being part of the official Pieces OS installation.
    * Intego's history of false positive detections.
    * App framework being a standard location for macOS application components.
    * Pieces OS being a legitimate development tool with specific system access requirements.

**Solutions:**

* Update Intego VirusBarrier virus definitions to the latest version.
* If the detection persists, report it to Intego as a false positive.
* Temporarily trust the files through VirusBarrier's interface.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The user is advised to try the recommended solutions and report back the results.
* @tsavo-at-pieces stated that they will further investigate the issue from their side.

**Key takeaway:**

This conversation highlights a potential false positive detection by Intego VirusBarrier and provides potential solutions for the user. However, further investigation and communication are required to determine the final outcome.
